2. Production: Production could be done either at NAEB member stations, at the CBC,
or in commercial studios, or all three, under the supervision of the Center. It
is believed that such universities as the University of Michigan, where annual
summer international gerontology conferences are held, and where Dr. Wilma
Donohue is available, might, with possible financial aid to enable the securing
of research, writing and production assistance, undertake such a series in whole
or in part. Boston is also the scene of considerable activity in this field.
A fine Industrial Program for Retired Persons has been on the air there for
some time, supported by the Agnew Foundation (Mr. John Agnew, First National
Bank of Boston).
It is also believed that actualities and interviews from other nations,
which might be provided by arrangements with the CBC, BBC, ABC (Australia),
RDF, RAI, and the Swiss and German Radio, with all of which the NAEB has excel¬
lent relationships, might greatly enrich understanding of the universal nature
of this problem. Later vise of some or all programs: of this series by those na¬
tions, and possibly by the International University of the Air, should also be
visualized, as mentioned below.
